Assume all contracts are for 100 shares. Answer with no explanation, only a classification. Given the expiration dates are the same, what is the name of the option strategy being implemented in the following? Sell 1 $17 strike price put at $1.25. Buy 1 $13 strike price put at $0.38. data.sampled: This is an example of a vertical spread, specifically a bull put spread. This strategy involves selling a put with a higher strike price and buying a put with a lower strike price, both with the same expiration date. The goal is to benefit from a neutral or moderately bullish market conditions, where the stock price is expected to stay above the higher strike price of the sold put, but below the lower strike price of the bought put. The credit received from selling the higher strike price put can offset the cost of buying the lower strike price put, creating a net credit received for the trade.
